courseArray.name: Introduction to Computer Science I
courseArray.descr: Computing and principles of programming with an emphasis on systematic program design. Topics include functional programming, data abstraction, procedural abstraction, use of control and state, recursion, testing, and object-oriented programming concepts. Requires no prior programming experience, open to any major, but intended primarily for majors and minors in computer science or mathematics.
courseArray.breadth: University: Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Technology; A&S: GROUP D: A&S Math, Nat Sci & Technology

courseArray.name: Introduction to Computer Science II
courseArray.descr: Principles of computer science illustrated and applied through programming in an object oriented language. Programming projects illustrate computational problems, styles and issues that arise in computer systems development and in all application areas of computation.
courseArray.preReq: Grade of C- or better in CISC 108 or CISC 106.
courseArray.breadth: University: Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Technology; A&S: GROUP D: A&S Math, Nat Sci & Technology

courseArray.name: Introduction to Systems Programming
courseArray.preReq: A grade of C- or better in CISC 106 or CISC 108.
